DOC.brief_title: The Study Active Transfer Plaque Technique Non-Left Main Coronary Bifurcation Lesions
DOC.detailed_description: A Prospective Multi-center Randomized Trial Assessing Efficacy Safety Active Transfer Plaque v . Provisional T Stenting Treatment Non-Left-Main Coronary Bifurcation Lesions . The purpose trial evaluate efficacy safety Active Transfer Plaque provisional T stenting technique treat non-left-main coronary bifurcation lesion base TLR rate 12-months post-procedure . Provisional T Stenting common technique BL treatment . Active Transfer Plaque ATP report , comparison two procedure . In ATP treatment bifurcation lesion , two wire advance distal main vessel ( MV ) side branch ( SB ) . Stent balloon advance MV SB respectively . The MV stent release dilate SB balloon . By predilating balloon target SB , plaque actively transfer SB MV . Subsequently , plaque fix expansive stent MV.As provisional T treatment , provisional T stenting typic step-T stenting . In brief , two wire advance distal MV SB . Predilation leave operator 's discretion , however , predilating SB encourage . Kissing balloon inflation stenting MV leave operator 's discretion . A stent stent/artery ratio 1.1:1 inflated MV . Rewire SB also leave operator 's discretion . FKBI recommend least one following : residual stenosis > 75 % , > type B dissection TIMI flow < 3 . All patient follow clinically 1- , 6- 12- 24-month stent implantation . Repeat angiographic follow-up recommend patient 12 month index procedure . The primary endpoint trial rate TLR 12-month follow-up .

( Medina 0,1,1 ; 1,1,1 ; 1,0,1 ; 1,1,0 ) . Patient eligible elective percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) . Patient acceptable candidate coronary artery bypass grafting ( CABG ) . Patient ( legal guardian ) understand trial requirement treatment procedure provide write informed consent trialspecific test procedure perform ; patient willing comply protocolrequired followup evaluation . Patient STEMI ( within 24hour onset chest pain admission ) . Patient know allergy study stent system protocolrequired concomitant medication adequately premedicated ( everolimus , aspirin , contrast medium , acrylic acid , Stainless steel ) . Patient intolerable dual antiplatelet therapy . Patient serious medical illness may reduce life expectancy le 12 month . Patient pregnant nursing . Patient participate another clinical trial reach primary endpoint . Patient severe calcify lesion need rotational atherectomy . Lesions instent restenosis .
